metadata.title: CVE-2021-46991 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: i40e:Fix use-after-free in i40e_client_subtask() Currently the call toi40e_client_del_instance frees the object pf->cinst, howeverpf->cinst->lan_info is being accessed after the free. Fix this by addingthe missing return. Addresses-Coverity: ("Read from pointer after free")

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46991` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
